name: Analytics
description: [Analytics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Analytics) is the systematic computational analysis of data or statistics. It is used for the discovery, interpretation, and communication of meaningful patterns in data.

name: Archiving and Digital Preservation (DP)
description: Digital [archiving](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Archival_science) and [preservation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_preservation) software.

name: Automation
description: [Automation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Automation) software designed to reduce human intervention in processes.

name: Backup
description: [Backup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Backup) software.

name: Blogging Platforms
description: A [blog](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blog) is a discussion or informational website consisting of discrete, diary-style text entries (posts).

name: Booking and Scheduling
description: Event scheduling, reservation, and appointment management software.

name: Bookmarks and Link Sharing
description: Software which allows users to add, annotate, edit, and share [bookmarks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bookmark_(digital)) of web documents.

name: Calendar & Contacts
description: [CalDAV](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CalDAV) and [CardDAV](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CardDAV) protocol servers and web clients/interfaces for [Electronic calendar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Calendaring_software), [address book](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Address_book) and [contact management](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Contact_manager).

external_links.title: Comparison of CalDAV and CardDAV implementations - Wikipedia

name: Communication - Custom Communication Systems
description: [Communication software](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Communication_software) used to provide remote access to systems and exchange files and messages in text, audio and/or video formats between different computers or users, using their own custom protocols.

name: Communication - Email - Complete Solutions
description: Simple deployment of [E-mail](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Email) servers, e.g. for inexperienced or impatient admins.

name: Communication - Email - Mail Delivery Agents
description: [Mail Delivery Agents](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Message_delivery_agent) (MDAs) - [IMAP](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internet_Message_Access_Protocol)/[POP3](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Post_Office_Protocol) server software.

name: Communication - Email - Mail Transfer Agents
description: [Mail Transfer Agents](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Message_transfer_agent) (MTAs) - [SMTP](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Simple_Mail_Transfer_Protocol) servers.

name: Communication - Email - Mailing Lists and Newsletters
description: [Mailing list](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mailing_list) servers and mass mailing software - one message to many recipients.

name: Communication - Email - Webmail Clients
description: [Webmail](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Webmail) clients.

name: Communication - IRC
description: [IRC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internet_Relay_Chat) communication software.

name: Communication - SIP
description: [SIP](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Session_Initiation_Protocol)/[IPBX](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IP_PBX) telephony software.

name: Communication - Social Networks and Forums
description: [Social Networking](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Social_networking_service) and [Forum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internet_forum) software.

name: Communication - Video Conferencing
description: [Video/Web Conferencing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_conferencing) tools and software.

name: Communication - XMPP - Servers
description: [Extensible Messaging and Presence Protocol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/XMPP) servers.

name: Communication - XMPP - Web Clients
description: [Extensible Messaging and Presence Protocol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/XMPP) Web clients/interfaces.

name: Community-Supported Agriculture (CSA)
description: Management and administration tools for community supported agriculture and food cooperatives.

name: Conference Management
description: Software for submission of [abstracts](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abstract_management) and preparation/management of academic conferences.

name: Content Management Systems (CMS)
description: [Content Management Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Content_management_system) offer a practical way to setup a website with many features, using third party plugins, themes and functionality that are easy to add and customize.

name: Database Management
description: Web interfaces for [database](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Database) management. Includes tools for database analytics and visualization.

name: DNS
description: [DNS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Domain_Name_System) servers and management tools with advertisement blocking funtionality, primarily aimed at home or small networks.

name: Document Management - E-books
description: [Ebook](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ebook) library management software.

name: Document Management - Institutional Repository and Digital Library Software
description: [Institutional repository](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Institutional_repository) and [digital library](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_library) management software.

name: Document Management - Integrated Library Systems (ILS)
description: An [integrated library system](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Integrated_library_system) is an enterprise resource planning system for a library, used to track items owned, orders made, bills paid, and patrons who have borrowed.

name: Document Management
description: A [document management system](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Document_management_system) (DMS) is a system used to receive, track, manage and store documents and reduce paper.

name: E-commerce
description: [E-commerce](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E-commerce) software.

name: Federated Identity & Authentication
description: [Federated identity](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federated_identity) and [authentication](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electronic_authentication) software.

name: Feed Readers
description: A [news aggregator](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/News_aggregator), also termed a feed aggregator, feed reader, news reader, [RSS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RSS) reader, is an application that aggregates web content such as newspapers/blogs/vlogs/podcasts in one location for easy viewing.

name: File Transfer - Distributed Filesystems
description: Network distributed filesystems.

name: File Transfer - Object Storage & File Servers
description: [Object storage](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Object_storage) is a computer data storage that manages data as objects, as opposed to other storage architectures like file systems which manages data as a file hierarchy, and block storage which manages data as blocks within sectors and tracks.

name: File Transfer - Peer-to-peer Filesharing
description: [Peer-to-peer file sharing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peer-to-peer_file_sharing) is the distribution and [sharing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File_sharing) of digital media using [peer-to-peer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peer-to-peer) (P2P) networking technology.

name: File Transfer - Single-click & Drag-n-drop Upload
description: Simplified file servers for sharing of one-time/short-lived/temporary files, providing single-click or [drag-and-drop](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drag_and_drop) updload functionality.

name: File Transfer - Web-based File Managers
description: Web-based [file managers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File_manager).

name: File Transfer & Synchronization
description: [File transfer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File_transfer), [sharing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File_sharing) and [synchronization software](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File_synchronization) software.

name: Games - Administrative Utilities & Control Panels
description: Utilities for managing game servers.

name: Games
description: Multiplayer game servers and [browser games](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Browser_game).

name: Genealogy
description: [Genealogy software](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Genealogy_software) used to record, organize, and publish genealogical data.

name: Groupware
description: Collaborative software or [groupware](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Collaborative_software) is designed to help people working on a common task to attain their goals. Groupware often regroups multiple services such as file sharing, calendar/events management, address books... in a single, integrated application.

name: Human Resources Management (HRM)
description: A [human resources management system](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_resource_management_system) combines a number of systems and processes to ensure the easy management of [human resources](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_resources), business processes and data.

name: Internet of Things (IoT)
description: [Internet of Things](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internet_of_things) describes physical objects with sensors, processing ability, software, and other technologies that connect and exchange data with other devices over the Internet.

name: Inventory Management
description: [Inventory management software](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inventory_management_software).

name: Knowledge Management Tools
description: [Knowledge management](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Knowledge_management) is the collection of methods relating to creating, sharing, using and managing the knowledge and information.

name: Learning and Courses
description: Tools and software to help with education and learning.

name: Manufacturing
description: Software to manage [3D printers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/3D_printing), [CNC machines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Numerical_control) and other physical manufacturing tools.

name: Maps and Global Positioning System (GPS)
description: [Maps](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Map), [cartography](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cartography), [GIS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geographic_information_system) and [GPS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Global_Positioning_System) software.

name: Media Streaming - Audio Streaming
description: [Audio](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Audio) streaming tools and software.

name: Media Streaming - Multimedia Streaming
description: [Multimedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Multimedia) streaming tools and software.

name: Media Streaming - Video Streaming
description: [Video](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Video) streaming tools and software.

name: Media Streaming
description: [Streaming media](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Streaming_media) is multimedia that is delivered and consumed in a continuous manner from a source, with little or no intermediate storage in network elements.

external_links.title: List of streaming media systems - Wikipedia
Comparison of streaming media systems - Wikipedia

name: Miscellaneous
description: Software that does not fit in another section.

name: Money, Budgeting & Management
description: [Money management](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Money_management) and budgeting software.

name: Monitoring
description: Software for [monitoring](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monitoring#Computing) systems, networks, applications and websites.

name: Note-taking & Editors
description: [Note taking](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Note-taking) editors.

name: Office Suites
description: An [office suite](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_office_suites) is a collection of productivity software usually containing at least a word processor, spreadsheet and a presentation program.

name: Password Managers
description: A [password manager](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Password_manager) allows users to store, generate, and manage their passwords for local applications and online services.

name: Pastebins
description: A [pastebin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pastebin) is a type of online content-hosting service used for sharing and storing code and text.

name: Personal Dashboards
description: Dashboards for accessing information and applications.

name: Photo and Video Galleries
description: A [gallery](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gallery_Software) is software that helps the user publish or share photos, pictures, videos or other digital media.

name: Polls and Events
description: Software for organising [polls](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Opinion_poll) and [events](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Event).

name: Proxy
description: A [proxy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Proxy_server) is a server application that acts as an intermediary between a client requesting a resource and the server providing that resource.

name: Recipe Management
description: Software and tools for managing [recipes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Recipe).

name: Remote Access
description: [Remote desktop](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Remote_desktop_software) and [SSH](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Secure_Shell) servers and web interfaces for remote management of computer systems.

name: Resource Planning
description: Software and tools to help with [resource and supply planning](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Resource_planning), including [enterprise resource and supply planning (ERP)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enterprise_resource_planning).

name: Search Engines
description: A [search engine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Search_engine_(computing)) is an [information retrieval system](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Information_retrieval) designed to help find information stored on a computer system. This includes [Web search engines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_search_engine).

name: Self-hosting Solutions
description: Software for easy installation, management and configuration of self-hosted services and applications.

name: Software Development - API Management
description: [API management](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/API_management) is the process of creating and publishing [application programming interfaces (APIs)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/API), enforcing their usage policies, controlling access, nurturing the subscriber community, collecting and analyzing usage statistics, and reporting on performance.

name: Software Development - Continuous Integration & Deployment
description: [Continuous integration](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Continuous_integration) and [Continuous deployment](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Continuous_deployment) software and tools.

name: Software Development - FaaS & Serverless
description: [Serverless computing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serverless_computing), [Function as a Service (FaaS)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Function_as_a_service) and [Platform as a Service (Paas)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Platform_as_a_service) management software.

name: Software Development - IDE & Tools
description: An [integrated development environment (IDE)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Integrated_development_environment) is a software application that provides comprehensive facilities to computer programmers for software development.

name: Software Development - Localization
description: [Localization](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internationalization_and_localization) is the process of adapting code and software to other languages.

name: Software Development - Low Code
description: A [low-code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Low-code_development_platform) development platform (LCDP) provides a development environment used to create application software through a graphical user interface.

name: Software Development - Project Management
description: Tools and software for [software project management](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Software_project_management).

name: Software Development - Testing
description: Tools and software for [software testing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Software_testing).

name: Software Development
description: [Software development](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Software_development) is the process of conceiving, specifying, designing, programming, documenting, testing, and bug fixing involved in creating and maintaining applications, frameworks, or other software components.

name: Static Site Generators
description: [Static site generators](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_template_system#Static_site_generators) generate full static HTML websites based on raw data, plain text files and a set of templates.

name: Status / Uptime pages
description: [Uptime](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uptime) is a measure of system reliability, expressed as the percentage of time a machine, typically a computer, has been working and available.

name: Task Management & To-do Lists
description: [Task management](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Task_management#Task_management_software) software.

name: Ticketing
description: [Helpdesk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Help_desk_software), [bug](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bug_tracking_system) and [issue](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Issue_tracking_system) tracking software to help the tracking of user requests, bugs and missing features.

name: Time Tracking
description: [Time-tracking software](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Time-tracking_software) is a category of computer software that allows its users to record time spent on tasks or projects.

name: URL Shorteners
description: [URL shortening](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/URL_shortening) is the action of shortening a [URL](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uniform_Resource_Locator) to make it substantially shorter and still direct to the required page. Before hosting one, please see [shortcomings](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/URL_shortening#Shortcomings) of URL shorteners.

name: Video Surveillance
description: Video surveillance, also known as [Closed-circuit television (CCTV)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Closed-circuit_television), is the use of video cameras for surveillance in areas that require additional security or ongoing monitoring.

name: VPN
description: A [virtual private network (VPN)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Virtual_private_network) extends a private network across a public network and enables users to send and receive data across shared or public networks as if their computing devices were directly connected to the private network.

name: Web Servers
description: A [web server](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_server) is a piece of software and underlying hardware that accepts requests via [HTTP](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypertext_Transfer_Protocol) (the network protocol created to distribute web content) or its secure variant [HTTPS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTPS).

name: Wikis
description: A [wiki](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wiki) is a publication collaboratively edited and managed by its own audience directly using a web browser.
